src:
Pecatur Sumenep Sabet Medali Emas di Kejurnas
01 Nov 2019, 11:09 by Famelia


Pecatur Sumenep Sabet Medali Emas di Kejurnas

KBRN, Sumenep : Kontingen catur Jawa Timur tampil sebagai juara umum pada Kejuaraan Nasional (Kejurnas) Catur ke 48 yang berlangsung di Islamic Center Ambon Maluku.
Dari 17 kategori yang dipertandingkan, para pecatur Jawa Timur berhasil meraih 6 medali emas, 9 medali perak dan 6 medali perunggu. Keberhasilan tersebut membuat kontingen Jawa Timur memperoleh Piala Bergilir PB Percasi dan Piala Tetap Gubernur Maluku.
Satu dari 6 medali emas yang diperoleh Kontingen Jawa Timur didapat atas perjuangan Rahmad Hanafi, atlet catur asal Kabupaten Sumenep. Hanafi meraih medali emas di Kategori Junior Open F U 9 itu.
Ketua Persatuan Catur Seluruh Indonesia (Percasi) Kabupaten Sumenep Moh. Suharjono mengaku sangat bangga atas prestasi anak didiknya itu. Karena atlet binaannya itu telah mengharumkan nama Provinsi Jawa Timur khususnya Kabupaten Sumenep di tingkat Nasional.
Meski diakui Suharjono, sebelum pertandingan dilaksanakan dirinya telah optimis, Hanafi dapat menyumbangkan medali emas untuk Jawa Timur. Sebab dirinya telah mengukur kemampuan anak didiknya serta lawan yang akan dihadapi. 
Hal itu berkaca dari kejuaraan catur yang digelar di Maluku bulan lalu, Hanafi dapat mengalahkan atlet yang pernah menjuarai Open Thailand.
“Alhamdulillah, atlet kami dapat menyumbangkan medali emas untuk Provinsi Jawa Timur pada Kejurnas tahun ini. Ini merupakan prestasi yag membanggakan bagi kami. Semoga kedepan akan banyak prestasi – prestasi yang ditorehkan oleh atlet Kota Keris,”Ujar Moh. Suharjono Ketua Percasi Sumenep Jum’at (01/11/2019)
Sementara itu Rahmad Hanafi mengaku bahagia karena telah menyumbangkan medali emas untuk Provinsi Jawa Timur.
Siswa SDN Karangduak 2 itu berharap, kedepan dirinya dapat terus mengharumkan nama Kabupaten Sumenep di tingkat Nasional.
“Saya sangat senang, dapat membawa medali emas,” terang Rahmad Hanafi. 
Sama halnya dengan Hanafi, orang tua siswa berusia 9 tahun itu Moh. Misnal juga merasa senang dan gembira. Menurutnya Kejurnas ini baru pertama kali diikuti oleh putra keduanya itu.
“Sebagai orang tua tentu saya sangat bangga anak saya dapat meraih medali emas. Karena Kejuaraan Nasional ini baru pertama kali diikuti,” ungkap orang tua Hanafi Moh. Misnal.
Atas keberhasilannya itu, selanjutnya Hanafi akan menjadi bagian Timnas Indonesia pada Kejuaraan Internasional yang akan digelar di Thailand.
text:
Chess Sumenep Chess Gold Medal in National Championship
Nov 01 2019, 11:09 by Famelia


Chess Sumenep Chess Gold Medal in National Championship

KBRN, Sumenep: East Java chess contingent emerged as the overall champion at the 48th Chess National Championship (Championship) which took place at the Ambon Maluku Islamic Center.
Of the 17 categories contested, East Java chess players won 6 gold medals, 9 silver medals and 6 bronze medals. These successes made the East Java contingent get the PB Percasi Rotating Cup and the Maluku Governor's Permanent Cup.
One of the 6 gold medals obtained by the East Java Contingent was won for the struggle of Rahmad Hanafi, a chess athlete from Sumenep Regency. Hanafi won the gold medal in the Junior Open F U 9 category.
Chairman of the All Indonesia Chess Association (Percasi) Sumenep Regency Moh. Suharjono claimed to be very proud of the achievements of his students. Because the fostered athlete has raised the name of East Java Province, especially Sumenep Regency at the National level.
Although Suharjono admitted that before the match he was optimistic, Hanafi could donate a gold medal for East Java. Because he has measured the ability of their students and the opponents they will face.
This is reflected in the chess championship held in Maluku last month, Hanafi can beat athletes who have won the Open Thailand.
"Alhamdulillah, our athlete can donate a gold medal for East Java Province at the National Championship this year. This is a proud achievement for us. Hopefully in the future there will be many achievements made by Keris City athletes, "Said Moh. Suharjono Chairperson of Percasi Sumenep Friday (01/11/2019)
Meanwhile Rahmad Hanafi claimed to be happy because he had donated a gold medal for East Java Province.
The Karangduak 2 Elementary School student hopes that in the future he can continue to make the name of Sumenep Regency national.
"I am very happy to be able to bring the gold medal," explained Rahmad Hanafi.
Similar to Hanafi, the 9-year-old student's parents, Moh. Misnal also feels happy and happy. According to him the National Championship was the first time followed by his second son.
"As a parent, of course I am very proud that my child can win the gold medal. Because this is the National Championship for the first time, "said Hanafi's parents Moh. Misnal
For his success, then Hanafi will become part of the Indonesian National Team at the International Championships which will be held in Thailand.
